title: Now that Crit has been "stat binded" to the Marksman role, can Garen's E be changed?
body:
During his initial rework Riot Rep had a version of Garen's Judgement that didn't crit, but had a higher base and scaling to compensate. 

Now that Ghostblade no longer has crit, and the only other Crit item is Infinity Edge with a measly 20% critical strike chance (since Riot wants you to build multiple crit items), these items are no longer attractive to Garen's build. 

Can he get his E reverted to the one before people complained about his build was being homogenized to a generic fighter now that stat binding exists?

replies.body: What are you requesting here? Your statement is confusing me

Garen E used to not crit, but it was made to do so.

Garen's main items used to have crit, but no longer do.

You need to build crit to benefit from crit.

Garen no longer builds crit, so OP wants the non-crit version of Garen's E instead of the version that crits.

^ This.

I'm bad at wording, so I can see how you could get confused.

> [{quoted}](name=HayRoss,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAE0J0iM,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2016-01-30T06:59:25.265+0000)
>
> WHAT IN THE NAME OF CRITMACIA IS THIS?
> 
> 
> {{item:3031}} {{item:1306}} {{item:3078}} {{item:3508}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3031}} 
> 
> 
> STAY BACK FROM MY CRITMACIA!!!

Nice essence reaver
Garen is literally always out of Mana. Even with Essence Reaver, his mana problems are still terrible

Crit's primarily a marksman and light fighter stat which binds items with it to those two classes generally. That's not a hard rule though, more a guideline - other classes using crit well won't be common, or at least optimal, but it's not necessarily a problem.

As far as Garen goes his optimal builds don't include any crit post item rework. The crit mechanic as a result's effectively there now just for people that want an alternate playstyle. Removing E critting wouldn't give us room to buff Garen's base damage on E or its scaling, it'd simply take away an off build some people do enjoy that doesn't seem to be unhealthy for the game.

>it'd simply take away an off build some people do enjoy that doesn't seem to be unhealthy for the game.

So with that mindset, may i asked why many items were removed/reworked that offered an alternate playstyle and weren't unhealthy?
Specifically ER, Trinity and Hurricane now beeing crit items which killed the option to opt out of crit on marksmen, but also why was zephyr removed? It didn't seem problematic and while beeing niche it had it's use cases.
But mostly, why Was ER reworked that drastically, rather than adding a new item for crit+cdr+mana?
The recent item changes took away many off builds i enjoyed and that weren't seen as unhealthy. I actually avoid marksmen now as i don't like rng, and marksmen now are brute forced into crit, not because of the new crit options, but because old no-cit options were taken away.

I think Zephyr just got removed to shred Tenacity as a stat. I hate that they did that, because they did it while boosting Marksman crit, which heavily bolstered both ADC and Mage roles, but left non-crit, non-CC roles as lackluster. I used to hate on the Yasuo/Trynda crit synergy, but the CC has gotten so crazy, I hardly care about it anymore.

LoL is a mechanically intensive game. It was nice to have an item like Zephyr to ensure I had a decent chance to get off my combos more than power them up. I guess Riot didn't agree, and are now giving CC free-reign to cripple everybody (unless you do actives, like QSS/Cleanse, of course).

Yet you're okay with completely removing AP Kog'Maw from the game?

Meddler, I like you man, but you contradict yourself sometimes.

> [{quoted}](name=BetaDude40,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAE0J0iM,comment-id=00150000,timestamp=2016-01-30T19:35:31.958+0000)
>
> Yet you're okay with completely removing AP Kog'Maw from the game?
> 
> Meddler, I like you man, but you contradict yourself sometimes.

I still believe that AP Kog played correctly is strong.

AP KogMaw=/=AP on-hit magic damage KogMaw.

The difference being Xerath to Kayle basically. Only if Kayle was really, really bad and required a ton of gold value to properly work, and she wouldn't perform anyways. And if Xerath was a fun off-meta build that worked because he had spammable long range spells he could use from relative safety, but didn't do as much damage thus were simply used in rapid succession. Oh, and he had no CC and resource sustain.

AP Kog was also extremely obnoxious to play against especially after he got Rylais. Not saying it was overpowered or anything but it was not fun getting nuked from 1800 range and being slowed in the process.

> [{quoted}](name=Ironhold,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAE0J0iM,comment-id=0015000000000001,timestamp=2016-01-31T02:10:03.511+0000)
>
> AP KogMaw=/=AP on-hit magic damage KogMaw.

Um... agree?

Don't know why you mentioned this.

Because AP kogmaw is dead.

Building Nashor's, Gunblade, Rageblade and the like, doesn't make him AP.

In my mind that needed clarification.

> [{quoted}](name=Ironhold,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAE0J0iM,comment-id=001500000000000100000000,timestamp=2016-01-31T03:22:14.338+0000)
>
> Because AP kogmaw is dead.
> 
> Building Nashor's, Gunblade, Rageblade and the like, doesn't make him AP.
> 
> In my mind that needed clarification.

No, but building RoA, Liandry's, Void Staff, Nashoor's, Deathcap does. And as I said, I still think it is strong if played correctly.

Just play Kayle if you're going to build like that. Or Diana; hell, Diana is **extremely** effective with that build and enjoys innate tankyness.

But he's not strong. It's not a matter of playing correctly. It's just that the only reason it was viable, his ulti, got fucked and nerfed, and the rest of his kit got overall nerfed/shafted in order to force him into this DPS immobile bad version of Kayle. 

And I mean truly immobile. If Koggy moves during his W, he actually loses DPS.

Different strokes for different folkes, but I will never like his new identity.
Oh, and on a sidenote, all those broken on-hit items will eventually get nerfed or fall out of meta, then he will lose practically everything.

Might just be I'm bad at Kog.

Though I thought it was somewhat understood that a huge portion of his identity and what made him fun was taken out during his rework, and that his new toys aren't as good since games end much sooner now.

I probably should have done more research before saying that though

> [{quoted}](name=BetaDude40,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAE0J0iM,comment-id=0015000000000000,timestamp=2016-01-30T20:11:28.911+0000)
>
> Might just be I'm bad at Kog.
> 
> Though I thought it was somewhat understood that a huge portion of his identity and what made him fun was taken out during his rework, and that his new toys aren't as good since games end much sooner now.
> 
> I probably should have done more research before saying that though

Nah, you were right on the money.

AP Kog is expressly awful right now in addition to his non-existent pick-rate.  There is *literally* no reason *ever* to pick AP Kog over Lux, Xerath, or Ziggs.

AP on-hit Kog'maw is a decent build right now, what with nashor's and guinsoo's giving him what basically amounts to .45 AP ratio per attack in addition to the %hp ratio.

I'd say it works better than AD kog currently.

> [{quoted}](name=Auz the Ripper,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAE0J0iM,comment-id=001500000000000000010000,timestamp=2016-01-30T23:40:28.879+0000)
>
> AP on-hit Kog'maw is a decent build right now, what with nashor's and guinsoo's giving him what basically amounts to .45 AP ratio per attack in addition to the %hp ratio.
> 
> I'd say it works better than AD kog currently.

But why wouldn't you pick Kayle instead?

Her damage might not be quite as high, but her utility *more* than makes up for it.

range mostly, plus his ult gives a _lot_ of executing power.

he's worse standing alone but better when there's a team standing behind (or more accurately in front of) him.

AP kogmaw is still pretty good on it's own, and still powerful in its own right. The problem is that AP kogmaw's playstyle has been shifted so that he can no longer poke people down before a fight starts, nullifying old ap kogmaw's biggest strength. New AP kogmaw simply doesn't have a place in the meta with its new playstyle, kinda like urgot has no place. It's numerically still powerful and still deals a lot of damage, but it just doesn't work.
How did they remove AP kog...?

Ult's poke damage is non-existent now with all of its damage being execute damage now which means he does little to no damage until someone is below half health.....which is terrible for a poke champion since your main goal is to poke before a fight starts and your ult will rarely get someone to that point on its own.
AP kog now has little poke but now has insane execution and dps vs all champions and builds. Again, how is AP kog dead as opposed to shuffled around in strategic niche?

Because it is not AP Kog anymore. It is on-hit Kog no matter how you look at it which is not the same playstyle in the slightest. It is the same reason people b*tched about Mordekaiser since they completely swapped his identity. AP Kog'maw would never have LOOKED at his W before but now is completely revolved around it.

> As far as Garen goes his optimal builds don't include any crit post item rework. The crit mechanic as a result's effectively there now just for people that want an alternate playstyle. Removing E critting wouldn't give us room to buff Garen's base damage on E or its scaling, it'd simply take away an off build some people do enjoy that doesn't seem to be _**unhealthy**_ for the game.

doesnt matter if its normal,bots,ranked, one for all, urf, doom bots

I don't give a shit.

Want to talk to me about PBE balance, show me gameplay from a "proper" PBE game.

Going in a custom, farming 45 bot kills, getting free stacks on Kindred's passive, gold and items, and then soloing baron, is not an example of PBE balance Kindred.

so aggressive, its a normal game in PBE

bye, good luck and have fun in the rift

Facts, are facts.

You're not fooling me, I know what you are and how you think.

Music's pretty cool though. 

Even if it's currently HAMMERING STRAIGHT INTO MY FUCKING EAR DRUMS

> [{quoted}](name=Meddler,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAE0J0iM,comment-id=0015,timestamp=2016-01-30T19:32:50.319+0000)

Removing E critting wouldn't give us room to buff Garen's base damage on E or its scaling, it'd simply take away an off build some people do enjoy that doesn't seem to be unhealthy for the game.

Mk.

How about you make it so E scales with 100% crit instead of 50%, so crit might actually be worth it?  Or maybe at least note it in the tooltip that it has reduced crit damage so people are aware of the flat -50% crit damage penalty?

Yes, this, please don't remove all my fun builds. I don't want this game to be like smite where you're pretty much forced down a very specific path for each God (champion). It's already rough with things like ap mf getting nerfed to the ground,
 :-(

It's not really stat binded to marksmen. {{champion:157}} and {{champion:23}} have mechanics attached to crit and I have a few melee champs that I get {{item:3094}} cannon on for that increased range on next hit and the 30% crit. Even if {{item:3094}} wasn't available, lots of melee assassins like {{champion:11}}  use things like {{item:3087}} and {{item:3046}}. sure melee champs aren't really building 100% crit chance, but a lot of melee fighters haven't been updated either. Specifically the ones who would get the most out of Crit (light fighters, assassins, possibly bruisers). 
But I think I get what you mean for Garen, as Juggernaut is definitely a class that doesn't  build crit items whatsoever (maybe {{item:3031}},but not likely), so it's kind of pointless to give him crit on abilities if it's at 0 the whole match.

Even though {{champion:157}}  and {{champion:23}} are not marksmen, they are ADC's, just melee ADC's. Ideally, they build the same as an ADC, so they are also marksmen, just melee. Yasuo even has 100% crit chance as a major goal, and Tryndamere gets rewarded for building crit.

> [{quoted}](name=Blue Moon Wolf,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=jAE0J0iM,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2016-01-30T11:22:10.088+0000)

Even if {{item:3094}} wasn't available, lots of melee assassins like {{champion:11}}  use things like {{item:3087}} and {{item:3046}}. sure melee champs aren't really building 100% crit chance, but a lot of melee fighters haven't been updated either. Specifically the ones who would get the most out of Crit (light fighters, assassins, possibly bruisers). 
> But I think I get what you mean for Garen, as Juggernaut is definitely a class that doesn't  build crit items whatsoever (maybe {{item:3031}},but not likely), so it's kind of pointless to give him crit on abilities if it's at 0 the whole match.

It's binded to Marksmen and Light Fighters, which Yasuo and Tryndamere are. Other examples of Light Fighters are Yi, which is only a secondary Assassin, much like Vayne, and Fiora (In theory)

My understanding is that they nerfed his damage on the pbe because it was too high and only added crit scaling because people requested it, rather than as compensation for those damage nerfs. They said themselves that adding crit scaling wasn't a big deal because they expected crit based builds to be inferior to juggernaut builds anyway.
The crit on E is pretty useless now indeed, but Garen isn't really in the need of a buff, especially not on his E.

it isn't a buff..

Just change from crit to something else.

That's a buff. They are asking to replace something he can't make use of with something he can make use of.

Following your logic Garen has been nerfed, as Riot has removed viable ways of building crit for him.

And by that Garen should be compensated.

Let's make a hypothetical comparison

The appendix is a vestigial, near useless organ, like crit on garen

It's not doing anything in or bodies besides occupying space.

If you take out the appendix and, thanks to the magic of either genetic engineering or biocybernetics, get it replaced by another part that, let's say, stabilizes your body temperature by a few degrees when it can.


Can you not see how this would put you ahead of a normal human that simply lacks his appendix?

AHAHAAH

You think you know bullshit boy? My main is Vlad. You don't get nothin' on me in terms of having your champ changed.



And you got "this shitstorm", which could only be considered a shitstorm to the most sensible of snowflakes would call a shitstorm, because your argument is wrong.


Crit on Garen is vestigial, and actively harmful, considering even one crit item sacrifices his juggernaut set-up. Crit is a current nonfactor, and as such taking it away warrants no compensation buffs.

Also, Dr. Mundo woodo hypothesis? IT's called a metaphor boy. One that makes sense given the current circumstances.


Someone doesn't agree with you. Boo fucking hoo. If this is how you react to an until now neutral discussion, I cringe to think what you'd do in real life

They put crit on Garen, because it made literally no difference balance-wise.

If they were to remove it he would **NOT** get compensation buffs.
